nodes.label: C3 Photosynthesis
nodes.description: The photosynthetic process in rice, characterized by its inefficiency due to Rubisco's slow catalytic rate and oxygenase activity, leading to photorespiration and energy loss.

nodes.label: C4 Photosynthesis
nodes.description: A more efficient photosynthetic pathway found in plants like maize and sorghum, concentrating CO2 around Rubisco to minimize photorespiration and improve resource use efficiency.

nodes.label: Rubisco
nodes.description: The enzyme responsible for carbon fixation in both C3 and C4 photosynthesis, but its limitations in C3 plants lead to inefficiency.

nodes.label: Photorespiration
nodes.description: A process that reduces the efficiency of photosynthesis in C3 plants due to Rubisco's oxygenase activity, leading to energy loss.

nodes.label: Rice (Oryza sativa)
nodes.description: A C3 plant targeted for genetic modification to enhance photosynthetic efficiency.

nodes.label: Maize (Zea mays)
nodes.description: A C4 plant serving as a model for C4 photosynthesis research.

nodes.label: Sorghum (Sorghum bicolor)
nodes.description: A C4 plant used in genetic studies of C4 photosynthesis.

nodes.label: CO2 Concentration
nodes.description: The mechanism in C4 plants that concentrates CO2 around Rubisco, enhancing photosynthetic efficiency.

nodes.label: Water Use Efficiency
nodes.description: Improved in C4 plants due to reduced photorespiration and enhanced CO2 fixation.

nodes.label: Nitrogen Use Efficiency
nodes.description: Improved in C4 plants due to enhanced photosynthetic efficiency.

nodes.label: Yield Increase
nodes.description: The primary goal of engineering C4 photosynthesis into rice, aiming for higher crop yields.

nodes.label: Gene Transfer
nodes.description: The process of transferring genes responsible for C4 photosynthesis into rice.

nodes.label: Leaf Anatomy
nodes.description: Significant modifications required for successful C4 rice development, including vein density and cell specialization.

nodes.label: Vein Spacing
nodes.description: A key anatomical feature that needs modification in rice to achieve efficient C4 photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Chloroplast Distribution
nodes.description: The arrangement of chloroplasts within leaf cells, requiring modification for optimal C4 function.

nodes.label: Metabolite Transport
nodes.description: Enhanced mechanisms needed for efficient C4 photosynthesis in engineered rice.

nodes.label: Genetic Engineering
nodes.description: Techniques used to identify and transfer genes responsible for C4 photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Mutagenesis
nodes.description: A technique used to study gene function in C4 photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Activation Tagging
nodes.description: A technique used to identify genes involved in C4 photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Setaria viridis
nodes.description: A model species used in C4 photosynthesis research.

nodes.label: Independent Evolution
nodes.description: C4 photosynthesis has evolved independently over 60 times in different plant taxa.
